snippet: Officer Timothy Loehmann, the patrolman who fatally shot the 12-year-old, said he saw the boy “reaching into his waistband” before firing his weapon.
abstract: Cleveland Police Officer Timothy Loehmann, who as a rookie officer fatally shot 12-year-old Tamir Rice in 2014, releases statement saying he saw boy 'reaching into his waistband' and 'pulling the gun out' before firing his own gun; boy's gun turned out to be fake; statement is first public accounting of shooting from Loehmann; Cuyahoga County grand jurors are said to be meeting to consider criminal charges in case.

byline.contributor: Richard A. Oppel Jr. contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Officer Timothy Loehmann, the patrolman who fatally shot the 12-year-old, said he saw the boy “reaching into his waistband” before firing his weapon.

headline.main: Cleveland Officer Says He Shot Tamir Rice After Fake Gun Was Pulled
headline.print_headline: Officer Says He Shot Boy After Fake Gun Was Pulled
